The Mediator

He is the judgment, and I am the blade

He is the gavel, and I am the bailiff

He is the shield, and I am the pike

He is the shepherd, and I am the lamb

My cause is noble and pure, for my cause is Dryg's cause

I ride forth with gavel and shield in hand to bring swift justice upon those who would wrong me, my kin, and my kith

As is the Mediator's will.

- A war devotional to Dryg

Dryg is one of the four children of Myn, who was given charge of the realm of divine magic. Adherent worshippers of Dryg believe in following the law to the letter and see the word of Dryg as absolute, with no room for debate. Thankfully, these fanatics are much fewer in number than average worshippers of the god who take heed to the tenets regarding protection, order, truth, and avoiding dispute. Dryg is often revered as a cornerstone to modern society, being the deity who after a fashion, is the reason cities and people exist and flourish. Many praises and thanks are given to Dryg for a variety of things such as mercantilism, roads, manufacturing, trade routes, military operations - anything that brings comfort and order to a modern city.

Edicts

  • Solve problems before they begin
  • Bring swift justice to those who cannot be reasoned with
  • Protect those around you at all costs

Anathema

  • Not attempting to protect the life of another
  • Allowing crimes to be committed without recourse
  • Antagonizing others into dispute

Areas of Concern

  • Divine Magic
  • Law
  • Order
  • Justice
  • Confrontation
